III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150 Incident reporting.
Section (4) When a resident’s behavior results in contact with law
Description enforcement, the incident shall be reported to the parent/legal
guardian, responsible referring agency, and the licensing
authority as soon as possible, but not more than 24 hours
after the incident.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Facility did not notify Licensing of contact with Law Enforcement
caused by a youth's behaviors.
Investigation During a video meeting on 02/23/2023 at 4:30 pm the facility Chief
Administrator informed DCWL of contact with law enforcement for
a current youth that occurred on 02/22/2023. Chief Administrator
acknowledged he had not notified DCWL timely during the call.
1

Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 02/24/2023 during an announced
face-to-face visit at the facility. Further information was gathered
about the incident in question and resulting documentation.
Documentation reviewed:
• Incident Report dated 02/22/2023 describing the incident
involving a youth encountering law enforcement on that
same date at 1:15 pm.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as the Chief Administrator
acknowledged he failed to notify DCWL within the required time
frame of a youth’s contact with Law Enforcement on 2/22/23 at
1:15pm, notifying DCWL on 2/23/23 at 4:30pm.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that the license remain unchanged upon acceptance of an
approved CAP.
